item.title: Changeset [1581]: XHTML error.
item.dc:creator: saxmatt
item.description: XHTML error.

item.title: Ticket #250 (Metaweblog API discards comment_status and ping_status) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Using a Metaweblog API client (BloGTK, in this case), I can't post a no-comments/no-ping article. The mwnewpost() function (called metaWeblog.newPost in XMLRPC) does parse the mt_allow_comments and mt_allow_comments XMLRPC parameters, it does pass them to the wp_insert_post() function, but that one just doesn't do anything with them.

item.title: Ticket #249 (Password protected entries don't show comment area) created
item.dc:creator: karsh
item.description:
Password protected entries in Wordpress 1.2 won't show the comment form even when the password has been entered.

​http://wordpress.org/support/3/12037

item.title: Ticket #248 (Links to reference on admin (post) screen should be changeable via ...) created
item.dc:creator: TigerDE2
item.description: The links on the post page inside WP to the WP reference located at ​http://wordpress.org/docs/reference/ should be changeable by editing the mo/po files in order to link to localized versions of the reference.

item.title: Ticket #119 ((more...) link not localisable) updated
item.dc:creator: TigerDE2
item.description: According to ​http://www.ihad.de/wordpress/index.php?p=15, the problem exists in the following files: wp-includes/class-smarty.php, l. 179: $more_link_text='(more...)'; should read $more_link_text=('(more...)'); template-functions-post.php, l. 58, 65 and 98 and possibly on other locations.

item.title: Ticket #247 (Sort get_archive() output by more than just post_date) created
item.dc:creator: skippy
item.description:
I have a need to sort the list of archives produced by wp_get_archives() and get_archives() alphabetically by post title, rather than chronologically by post_date. Adding two extra variables: "order" and "sort" to both functions would allow users to define additional sort and order terms. For example:

wp_get_archives("type=postbypost&sort=post_title&order=ASC")

item.title: Changeset [1580]: added Emmanuel Frecon's fix to create directories in ...
item.dc:creator: michelvaldrighi
item.description: added Emmanuel Frecon's fix to create directories in mw.newMediaObject, removed some useless (and/or potentially dangerous) debug strings

item.title: Ticket #246 (some comment type strings left unsranslated) created
item.dc:creator: nbachiyski
item.description: In all 2 calls (in wp-comments.php, wp-comments-popup.php) to comment_type (​http://wiki.wordpress.org/comment_type) no parameter values are supplied. However in the function if no explicit values are specified the default ones are printed directly and thus always the English terms are used.

item.title: Ticket #70 (Trackbacks Failing) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: I have find a solution for trackbacks bug that works fine for me. You can view it on my weblog: ​http://iozblog.ionosfera.com/archives/2004/08/29/wordpress_trackback_fix/ I hope that it helps you.

item.title: Ticket #245 (Missing $ wp-admin/upload.php line 174) updated

item.description: this has already been fixed in cvs

item.title: Ticket #245 (Missing $ wp-admin/upload.php line 174) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Line 174 in wp-admin/upload.php seems to be missing a dollar sign. (!moved) should be (!$moved)

item.title: Ticket #185 (wp-login.php segfaults Apache with PHP5.0.1-dev) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
I can confirm the bug.

I use: Apache/2.0.50 (Gentoo/Linux) PHP/5.0.1 WordPress 30-08-2004

item.title: Ticket #100 (Support for a "keywords" field) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
I came here through the recent discussion in the wp-hackers mailing list (web output, I am not yet a member). One of the advantages that MT has over WP when it comes to keywords is that it supports them at the XMLRPC level. Do you have any ideas how it would be possible to fix such a thing?

In more details, MT extends the metaWeblog API to support a mt_keywords field when editing and creating posts.

item.title: Ticket #209 (Subject line of sent e-mails is not UTF-8) updated
item.dc:creator: cal
item.description:
the attached patch adds the function mail_encoded() with a similar prototype to mail().

it added the relevant email headers (mime-type, version and optionally from) and escapes the subject using quoted printable.

item.title: Ticket #232 (Need a comment_type()-like function that returns comment type instead ...) updated
item.dc:creator: cal
item.description:
oops - ignore the first attachment - wrong file.

the second attached diff moves the function's workings into comment_type_get() which returns the result. comment_type() just echo's the result of comment_type_get().

item.title: Ticket #240 (duplicate category names cause DB error even on different category levels) updated
item.dc:creator: cal
item.description: appended is a patch which makes the unique key a composite of the name and parent category.

item.title: Ticket #220 (GB Pound sign problems) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Not a bug as such, you just need to switch the encoding back to iso-8859-1.
